AUTORUN.LOOP_TOOLTIP: The robot will repeat all sequences in an infinite loop. Press the top button once to deactivate autorun.
AUTORUN.ONE_SHOT_TOOLTIP: The robot will do one sequence and stop. Press the top button to activate the robot for the next sequence.
AUTORUN.CONNECT_TO_ROBOT_FIRST: You need to connect to the robot first.

ALERT.WAIT_UPDATE_COMPLETED: Please wait until software update has completed and that this popup closes automatically. (Update time may vary depending of your internet connection speed).
ALERT.MOTOR_DEBUG_MODE_ON_TOOLTIP: One or more motors are disabled
ALERT.OUT_OF_BOUNDS_JOINTS: One or several axis are out of bounds

CALIBRATION.HOW_TO_CALIBRATE_NIRYO_ROBOT: How to calibrate your Niryo Robot ?
CALIBRATION.CALIBRATION_INSTRUCTION_1: 1. If this is the first time you use your robot, you need to use the Automatic Calibration (please remove any attached tool to avoid collisions during the calibration).
CALIBRATION.CALIBRATION_INSTRUCTION_2: 2. You can then use the Manual Calibration every time you need to calibrate the robot (It is much faster, and you don't loose any precision).
CALIBRATION.CALIBRATION_INSTRUCTION_3: - To use the Manual Calibration, place the robot at home position (line up the small arrows on the side of the robot).
CALIBRATION.CALIBRATION_INSTRUCTION_4: - Then click on 'Manual Calibration', and that's it ! The robot will be calibrated exactly as it was calibrated the last time you used the Auto Calibration.
CALIBRATION.CALIBRATION_INSTRUCTION_5: - If you notice that the calibration is not OK, you can always run a new Auto Calibration.

ROBOT_CONNECTION.TOOLTIP_SELECTED_ID: The IP address you have selected
ROBOT_CONNECTION.TOOLTIP_SEARCH_ROBOTS: Find robots connected in your Wi-Fi network. IP addresses will appear on the 'select box' above. (On Windows, make sure to add an exception for Niryo Studio in your firewall)
ROBOT_CONNECTION.TOOLTIP_CUSTOM_IP: You can choose an IP from the box above, or manually choose one here.

WIFI_SETTINGS.ROBOT_NAME_TOOLTIP: This name will be used to easily find the robot in a Wi-Fi network, and to name Hotspot network. You need to reboot the robot to see the new name.
WIFI_SETTINGS.HOW_TO_CONNECT_TO_WIFI: How to connect the robot to a Wi-Fi network?
WIFI_SETTINGS.WIFI_INSTRUCTION_1: 1. If the LED on the robot is blue (Hotspot Mode) -> check for a Wi-Fi network starting with 'Niryo_Robot' and connect your computer to it (password: 'niryorobot').
WIFI_SETTINGS.WIFI_INSTRUCTION_2: 2. Open the menu 'ROBOT CONNECTION' by clicking on the small arrow in the upper right corner. Select the Niryo Robot hotspot IP address (10.10.10.10) and click 'Connect to Niryo Robot'.
WIFI_SETTINGS.WIFI_INSTRUCTION_3: 3. Fill in the name of the Wi-Fi name and password on the left and click on 'Connect Robot to Wi-Fi'.
WIFI_SETTINGS.WIFI_INSTRUCTION_4: 4. Re-connect your computer to this Wi-Fi network (the robot will try to connect as well).
WIFI_SETTINGS.WIFI_INSTRUCTION_5: 5. Wait ~20 seconds. The LED should become green, it means the robot is connected to a Wi-Fi network.
WIFI_SETTINGS.WIFI_INSTRUCTION_6_B: button to find Niryo Robot IP.
WIFI_SETTINGS.WIFI_INSTRUCTION_7: 7. Once you get the IP, select it on the box on the right tab, and click on 'Connect to Niryo Robot'.
WIFI_SETTINGS.AFTER_CLICK_ON_CONNECT_TO_WIFI_1: The robot will try to connect to the Wi-Fi, in order to do this operation, raspberry pi must shutdown hotspot mode or current wifi connection so disconnection may occur depending of your current connection method.
WIFI_SETTINGS.AFTER_CLICK_ON_CONNECT_TO_WIFI_2_A: On success: the LED will become green. You will be able to connect to the Wi-Fi
WIFI_SETTINGS.AFTER_CLICK_ON_CONNECT_TO_WIFI_2_B: and then connect to the robot.
WIFI_SETTINGS.AFTER_CLICK_ON_CONNECT_TO_WIFI_3: On failure: Ned will restart its network to hotspot mode (blue LED after ~30 seconds).
WIFI_SETTINGS.AFTER_CLICK_ON_HOTSPOT_MODE: When Ned LED becomes blue, the robot will be in hotspot mode.
WIFI_SETTINGS.WARNING_DISCONNECTION: You may be disconnected by changing raspberry network configuration, for more informations please click on the following icon:

NETWORK_SETTINGS.RESET_CONFIRMATION: Are you sure you reset network settings ?

RPI_SETTINGS.PURGE_ROS_LOGS_ON_STARTUP: Purge ROS logs on RPi startup
RPI_SETTINGS.ROS_LOG_TOOLTIP: ONLY DISABLE IF YOU WANT TO LOOK AT THE LOGS ON THE RPI FOR DEBUG PURPOSES. If the RPI is full, the robot may have some problems to start.

SOFTWARE_VERSIONS.CONNECT_TO_ROBOT: Connect to the robot to get current version.
SOFTWARE_VERSIONS.COULD_NOT_GET_LATEST_VERSION: Could not get latest version. Make sure you are connected to Internet.
SOFTWARE_VERSIONS.NEED_INTERNET_TO_UPDATE: An update is available for your robot, please connect your Ned to a network that give access to internet in order to make use of the update.

MOTOR.INFO_1: Please move the robot in home position and make sure to have space around the robot.
MOTOR.INFO_2: Do not touch the robot until report completion.
MOTOR.NOT_CONNECTED: Not connected to a Niryo Robot.
MOTOR.INSTRUCTION_2: Uncheck motors to disable them. The robot will reboot with the new configuration. Don't forget to re-enable all the motors after you've made your tests.

STEP1.DESCRIPTION: The robot's axis motors will restart. Stay alert to avoid possible collisions with the robot.

STEP2.DESCRIPTION: Place the robot in the Home position using the FreeMotion on the arm.
STEP2.NEXT: I confirm that the robot is in the Home position

IMPORT_EXPORT_BLOCKS_XML.SAVE_AS_SEQUENCE_ON_ROBOT: Save as a Sequence directly on the robot

SOFTWARE_UPDATE.ROBOT_SOFTWARE_UPDATE_AVAILABLE: A software update is available for your robot
SOFTWARE_UPDATE.ROBOT_WILL_RESTART: Robot will now reboot in a few seconds, you will be disconnected from Niryo Studio. Please wait until the robot has properly rebooted (LED color change from red to blue or green) in order to reconnect to the robot.

SHUTDOWN_RPI.TITLE: Are you sure?
SHUTDOWN_RPI.MESSAGE: Are you sure you want to shutdown the Raspberry Pi board?

REBOOT_RPI.TITLE: Are you sure?
REBOOT_RPI.MESSAGE: Are you sure you want to reboot the Raspberry Pi board? If yes, please do not power OFF the robot while it is rebooting.

DEBUG_MOTORS.TITLE: Are you sure?
DEBUG_MOTORS.MESSAGE: This action will disable some motors (unchecked boxes) and enable other motors (checked boxes). Don't power OFF the robot while it's rebooting. Also, make sure to re-enable all the motors after you're done with your tests.

SIMULATION_MODE.TITLE: Disable all motors for simulation
SIMULATION_MODE.MESSAGE: This will simply disable all motors on your robot. Note: you still need to be connected to a Niryo Robot to see the robot 3D view. You'll then need to reactivate all motors to use the robot.

DELETE_SEQUENCE.TITLE: Delete Sequence
DELETE_SEQUENCE.MESSAGE: Are you sure you want to delete this sequence?

DELETE_POSITION.TITLE: Delete Position
DELETE_POSITION.MESSAGE: Are you sure you want to delete this position?

DELETE_TRAJECTORY.TITLE: Delete Trajectory
DELETE_TRAJECTORY.MESSAGE: Are you sure you want to delete this trajectory?

DELETE_FRAME.TITLE: Delete Frame
DELETE_FRAME.MESSAGE: Are you sure you want to delete this frame?

DELETE_PROGRAM.TITLE: Delete Program
DELETE_PROGRAM.MESSAGE: Are you sure you want to delete this program?

OVERWRITE_PROGRAM.TITLE: Overwrite programme
OVERWRITE_PROGRAM.MESSAGE: This program already exist. Do you want to overwrite it?

NEW_PROGRAM.TITLE: Delete Program
NEW_PROGRAM.MESSAGE: This action will delete the current workspace. Delete the current workspace ?

ERROR_ROBOT_CONNECTION.TITLE: Robot connection error
ERROR_ROBOT_CONNECTION.MESSAGE: Try to reconnect to the robot

ACCEPT_RGPD.TITLE: GDPR Consent
ACCEPT_RGPD.TEXT: Please accept our terms of use.

LAUNCH_AUTO_DIAGNOSIS.TITLE: Launch auto diagnosis
LAUNCH_AUTO_DIAGNOSIS.INTRO: Note: To carry out the auto-diagnosis, the robot must first be calibrated and have an internet connection.
LAUNCH_AUTO_DIAGNOSIS.TEXT: Caution: During the auto-diagnosis, the robot makes movements. The area around the robot must be clear.

UPDATE_MOTORS.TITLE: Update motors
UPDATE_MOTORS.TEXT: Be careful, the robot will restart. Once restarted, the engines will be updated.

VISION.DEBUG_EXPLAINATION: Debug mode will display the position of the markers and the objects found
VISION.CREATE_WORKSPACE_STEP_0: Equip the workspace tool to the robot arm, place the workspace paper at the desired position and click on next arrow (or push robot top button)
VISION.CREATE_WORKSPACE_STEP_1: Move the arm to the origin landmark (top left corner) and click on save position (or push robot top button)
VISION.CREATE_WORKSPACE_STEP_2: Move the arm to the landmark 2 (clockwise) and click on save position (or push robot top button)
VISION.CREATE_WORKSPACE_STEP_3: Move the arm to the landmark 3 (clockwise) and click on save position (or push robot top button)
VISION.CREATE_WORKSPACE_STEP_4: Move the arm to the landmark 4 (clockwise) and click on save position (or push robot top button)
VISION.CREATE_WORKSPACE_STEP_5: Change the workspace name and click on save position (or push robot top button)
VISION.MEMO_VISION: Everytime your want to use vision capabilities, the robot must be in an observation position where the 4 landmarks of the workspace area are fully visible by the camera and that the camera is as parallel as possible to the workspace.
VISION.TIPS_CAMERA_POSITION: Tips: To place the camera in an optimal position, favor a position with pitch values ​​= 1.57, yaw = 0 and a roll ~= 0 (to be adjusted according to vision / gripper)
VISION.REFER_TO_USER_MANUAL: (For more information, please consult the user manual)

PROGRAM.NAME: Name
PROGRAM.CANT_EXECUTE_PROGRAM: Can't execute program. Not a python program
PROGRAM.CANT_OPEN_IN_NIRYO_BLOCKS: Can't open program in Niryo Blocks. No blockly program
PROGRAM.UPLOAD_PYTHON_PROGRAM: Upload a Python program on the robot
PROGRAM.UPLOAD_PROGRAM_INFO: The program should use the Python ROS Wrapper

GLOBAL.FEATURE_NOT_AVAILABLE: Feature not available in this version. Only available with Ned 2
